overview:
This class allows you interact with DLP API.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, google-cloud.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as @google-cloud/dlp.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var dlp = gcloud.dlp();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var dlp = gcloud.dlp({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: InfoType
methods.description: Type of information detected by the API.

params.name: name
params.description: Name of the information type. For built-in info types, this is provided by the API call ListInfoTypes. For user-defined info types, this is provided by the user. All user-defined info types must have unique names, and cannot conflict with built-in info type names.

methods.name: FieldId
methods.description: General identifier of a data field in a storage service.

params.name: columnName
params.description: Column name describing the field.

methods.name: PartitionId
methods.description:
Datastore partition ID. A partition ID identifies a grouping of entities. The grouping is always by project and namespace, however the namespace ID may be empty.

A partition ID contains several dimensions: project ID and namespace ID.

params.name: projectId
params.description: The ID of the project to which the entities belong.

params.name: namespaceId
params.description: If not empty, the ID of the namespace to which the entities belong.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the kind.

methods.name: PropertyReference
methods.description: A reference to a property relative to the Datastore kind expressions.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the property. If name includes "."s, it may be interpreted as a property name path.

methods.name: Projection
methods.description: A representation of a Datastore property in a projection.

params.name: property
params.description:
The property to project.

This object should have the same structure as PropertyReference

methods.name: DatastoreOptions
methods.description: Options defining a data set within Google Cloud Datastore.

params.name: partitionId
params.description:
A partition ID identifies a grouping of entities. The grouping is always by project and namespace, however the namespace ID may be empty.

This object should have the same structure as PartitionId

params.name: kind
params.description:
The kind to process.

This object should have the same structure as KindExpression

params.name: projection
params.description:
Properties to scan. If none are specified, all properties will be scanned by default.

This object should have the same structure as Projection

methods.name: CloudStorageOptions
methods.description: Options defining a file or a set of files (path ending with *) within a Google Cloud Storage bucket.

params.name: fileSet
params.description: This object should have the same structure as FileSet

params.name: url
params.description: The url, in the format gs://<bucket>/<path>. Trailing wildcard in the path is allowed.

params.name: path
params.description: The url, in the format of gs://bucket/<path>.

params.name: datastoreOptions
params.description:
Google Cloud Datastore options specification.

This object should have the same structure as DatastoreOptions

params.name: cloudStorageOptions
params.description:
Google Cloud Storage options specification.

This object should have the same structure as CloudStorageOptions

methods.name: CloudStorageKey
methods.description: Record key for a finding in a Cloud Storage file.

params.name: filePath
params.description: Path to the file.

params.name: startOffset
params.description: Byte offset of the referenced data in the file.

methods.name: DatastoreKey
methods.description: Record key for a finding in Cloud Datastore.

params.name: entityKey
params.description:
Datastore entity key.

This object should have the same structure as Key

methods.name: Key
methods.description: A unique identifier for a Datastore entity. If a key's partition ID or any of its path kinds or names are reserved/read-only, the key is reserved/read-only. A reserved/read-only key is forbidden in certain documented contexts.

params.name: partitionId
params.description:
Entities are partitioned into subsets, currently identified by a project ID and namespace ID. Queries are scoped to a single partition.

This object should have the same structure as PartitionId

params.name: path
params.description:
The entity path. An entity path consists of one or more elements composed of a kind and a string or numerical identifier, which identify entities. The first element identifies a root entity, the second element identifies a child of the root entity, the third element identifies a child of the second entity, and so forth. The entities identified by all prefixes of the path are called the element's ancestors.

A path can never be empty, and a path can have at most 100 elements.

This object should have the same structure as PathElement

methods.name: PathElement
methods.description:
A (kind, ID/name) pair used to construct a key path.

If either name or ID is set, the element is complete. If neither is set, the element is incomplete.

params.name: kind
params.description: The kind of the entity. A kind matching regex __.*__ is reserved/read-only. A kind must not contain more than 1500 bytes when UTF-8 encoded. Cannot be "".

params.name: id
params.description: The auto-allocated ID of the entity. Never equal to zero. Values less than zero are discouraged and may not be supported in the future.

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the entity. A name matching regex __.*__ is reserved/read-only. A name must not be more than 1500 bytes when UTF-8 encoded. Cannot be "".

methods.name: RecordKey
methods.description: Message for a unique key indicating a record that contains a finding.

params.name: cloudStorageKey
params.description: This object should have the same structure as CloudStorageKey

params.name: datastoreKey
params.description: This object should have the same structure as DatastoreKey
